tit.cmt: " "削除しました。Koumaに訂正しました。

sen.j: 小馬命婦（こうまのみょうぶ、生没年不詳）は、平安時代円融朝の女流歌人。
sen.e: "KOUMA no Myobu," whose birth & death year is unknown, was a female maker of Japanese poetry during the reign of Emperor Enyu in the Heian period.
"KOUMA no Myobu," whose year of birth & death are unknown, was a femal Japanese poet during the reign of Emperor Enyu in the Heian period.
Kouma no Myobu (year of birth and death unknown) was a female waka poet during the reign of Emperor Enyu in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。Koumaに訂正しました。femaleスペル訂正しました。表記訂正しました。waka poet と訂正しました。

sen.j: 家集に「小馬命婦集」があり、「拾遺和歌集」、「新古今和歌集」などの勅撰和歌集にも入集している。
sen.e: She compiled "Kouma-no-Myobu shu" (Personal Poetry Collection of Kouma no Myobu), and her poems were selected into "Chokusen wakashu" (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command), such as "Shui Wakashu" (Collection of Gleanings) & "Shinkokin Wakashu" (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).

She compiled "Kouma-no-Myobu shu" (Personal Poetry Collection of Kouma no Myobu), and her poems were selected into "Chokusen wakashu" (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command), such as "Shui Wakashu" (Collection of Gleanings) & "Shinkokin Wakashu" (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).

She compiled 'Kouma no Myobu shu' (Personal Poetry Collection of Kouma no Myobu), and her poems were selected into Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command), such as 'Shui Wakashu' (Collection of Gleanings) and 'Shinkokin Wakashu' (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。ハイフン削除、スペース補足しました。原文に合せて" "削除しました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.e: "Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu"
"Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu"
Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu

sen.j: 上記の歌人のほかに、枕草子で知られる清少納言の娘として別人の小馬命婦がいる。
sen.e: Apart from the Japanese poetry maker above, there was another "KOUMA no Myobu" who was the daughter of "Seishonagon," well-known for "Makura no soshi" (The Pillow Book).
Apart from the Japanese poetry maker above, there was another "KOUMA no Myobu" who was the daughter of "Seishonagon," well-known for "Makura no soshi" (The Pillow Book).
Apart from the Japanese poetry maker above, there was another Kouma no Myobu who was the daughter of Sei shonagon, well-known for "Makura no soshi" (The Pillow Book).
sen.cmt: " "削除しました。Koumaに訂正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.e: This Myobu's father was "FUJIWARA no Muneyo."
Myobu's father was "FUJIWARA no Muneyo."
Myobu's father was "FUJIWARA no Muneyo."

sen.j: 一条天皇の皇后藤原彰子に仕えたことから上東門院小馬命婦とも称される。
sen.e: She served "FUJIWARA no Shoshi" (called Jotomonin), the empress of Emperor Ichijo, so she was called "Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu."
She served "FUJIWARA no Shoshi" (called Jotomonin), the empress of Emperor Ichijo, so she was called "Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu."
She served FUJIWARA no Shoshi (called Jotomonin), the empress of Emperor Ichijo, so she was called Jotomonin Kouma no Myobu.

sen.j: 「後拾遺和歌集」に歌が載せられている。
sen.e: Myobu's poem was selected into "Goshui Wakashu"(Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
Myobu's poem was selected into "Goshui Wakashu"(Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
Myobu's poem was selected into 'Goshui Wakashu' (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
